title: Windows 8.0 AIO 18in1 x64 en-US Pre-Activated FINAL Nov2013
description:
*This release will not fit on a single-layer DVDR or Fat32 UFD*
*Use a Dual-layer DVDR, Blu-Ray, or 8+GB NTFS Formatted UFD*

murphy78 presents Windows 8.0 AIO 18in1 x64 en-US FINAL Nov2013
Contains KB files to bring setup current to Nov12-2013 patch date

No Windows 8.0 Settings were harmed in the making of this ISO.
No Programs are added to Windows.
No Registry Settings were modified.
No Unattended Settings were added to the ISO.

x64 MSDN Sources:
en_windows_8_enterprise_n_x64_dvd_918052.iso
en_windows_8_enterprise_x64_dvd_917522.iso

These RTM Sources are the final Build 9200

Enterprise versions give Incorrect EULA because the ei.cfg is set to
Retail Channel, but it installs correctly and activates correctly.

SC Config and SC Create (KMS-Activated index)
Reboot for Servicing Stack configuration completion

Features:
-Non-Activated indexes and KMS-Activated indexes
KMS-Activated indexes will Activate before first logon and
renew activation every 7 days.
-Recent Windows Updates included for extra security
-Included notes from my KMS-SS for Office activation
and other information. You do not need to read to use.
-MS DaRT8 SP1 integrated into "Repair this computer" boot option
-UEFI boot information added to the ISO boot data
-Scripts folder added to ISO. I have included a few useful scripts
such as the Windows Update service restart, NetFx3 add, Windows Update's
SoftwareDistribution download folder deletion, and the WinSXS clean script.

(I recommend everyone clean the WinSXS folder at least once after
install to re-compress the WinSXS folder using the new compression from the
servicing stack update. It will take one to three hours and seem to be
stuck at 60 percent but let it work. It will finish. Saves about 2GB for
x64 version)

Changes from recent Windows 8.0 AIO releases:
-FINAL version of Win8.0-AIO
-.Net4.5.1 added
-Highly methodical manual integration for FINAL release to reduce unnecessary
extra hotfixes.

Windows 8.0 Final Notes:
-I could keep integrating 8.0 and these versions would get incredibly large,
but a better option is to just support Microsoft's push to 8.1.
-Windows 8.1 is basically the same as 8.0 now that they've patched a few
performance issues, and when the custom downloaded drivers become stable,
it will be largely glitch-free.
-MS has decided to end support for 8.0 in a couple years, but I'm not going
to prolong the inevitable, especially to people who aren't paying for the
product.
-In 8.1, there is a /resetbase command that reduces the footprint of the
winsxs windows folder by removing uninstall information from installed
KB-Files, and making the existing ones permanent. There wasn't really a
strong need for this in Windows 7 since all of the patches were small, but
in 8.0 they started being HUGE. I think they patch a lot of graphical
information in apps and such. It's the only reason I can think for them
being so large.
-The final version is not a patch because I'm likely going to be deleting
old torrents in the future. Obviously I won't delete FINAL versions, in case
people still want to use them for some reason.
-So please, if you like 8.0, great. I made this for you. Just please,
don't ask me to keep making monthly versions for it, because it's not going
to happen. If you want to learn how to keep making 8.0 versions I have a
thread on MDL for that very purpose: <a href="
http://forums.mydigitallife.info/threads/47875-Windows-Integration-Guide-murphy78" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://forums.mydigitallife.info/threads/47875-Windows-Integration-Guide-murphy78</a>
